data.title: Excellent Open Face
data.text: The prime rib petite cut was absolutely delicious. Served with the meats natural juices, French fries, and a pickle on toasted sliced bread.. amazing. The breakfast buffer was included since we booked direct and that was amazing too.

data.title: Breakfast-Don't Bother
data.text: My wife and I wanted to try this after reading the reviews and looking at photos. What a disappointment! Sunday is buffet only: lukewarm coffee, lukewarm scrambled eggs, bland blintz, lukewarm breakfast potatoes, lukewarm sausage (though the flavor was good)--all for the low, low price of $11.95 pp. There was nothing photogenic here this morning.

data.title: Pleasantly surprised
data.text: We just dropped in had not been here in eons glad we did...the prices for rack of lamb and prime rib were excellent...but the proof is how it is prepared ..we are pleased to announce it was perfect tasty sides of garlic smash potato with the prime rib was delish and the lamb on  a great white bean  and brocollibi ..just great..,camp with a nice salad...

data.title: great late night meal
data.text: we arrived at the inn after 8 and were hoping to get a bite to eat even if from the bar menu. To our surprise we were able to get a full meal that was, by the way, out of this world! The salad that came with dinner was amazing, the ribs to die for and the service was nothing short of exceptional.

data.title: Good food
data.text: One of the best restaurant in town . it serves food all day long . Best steak and prime rib in town , local people in town come to eat to enjoy quality food with very good service

data.title: Wonderful Easter Dinner.
data.text: We were looking for a nice restaurant for Easter dinner for our family of 5 and Adam's Rib was recommended. We were very happy we decided to try it. The pre-fixed holiday menu was more extensive that in any other restaurant we have tried in recent years and everyone loved the food. Two of our group had the prime rib, one had the shrimp on a bed of rice and vegetables, one had the sole and I had the rack of lamb (yes with mint jelly).  There were several other choices as well. Everything was cooked perfectly and was delicious.  A choices from 2 appeatizers and several deserts were also included in a very reasonable price. Tables were set with white tablecloths and linen napkins in holiday colors with the name of your party on the table. Nice touch.  Must acknowledge our server, Brian, very friendly and very professional.

data.title: Absolutly Amazing A+
data.text: We had the best dining experience at Adam's Rib. The hotel was bustling with locals and drinks were the best. On a weekend night you feel like part of a crowd. The atmosphere is lively and the food was tender and delicious. We would go back in a heartbeat.

data.title: Food is Okay..  Worth a ride regardless
data.text:
We went there recently while we stayed at their motel. 

The food was okay - it seemed to lack flavor with some dishes but still edible.    The service was acceptable and the decor of the restaurant wasn't that desirable. 

None the less, we filled our stomachs and was acceptable for the time where were there.   I wouldn't necessary shy people away from here, rather, let them know what they're getting into.

data.title: Excellent food and prices!
data.text: We stayed with our children and extended family. The food was excellent and the prices were amazing for all the food you get. You have a range from pub food to prime rib.

data.title: Fantastic Service
data.text: I want to compliment the management and staff at the Norwalk Inn on Adam's Rib. Our family ate there while we were in Connecticut and we have never had as good service as we did there. Brian our server did an exceptional job. He had several large tables, mixed our drinks, and answered the phone on a couple of occasions. He treated us like we were the only customers he was waiting on. This guy was a Jack of all trades! Kudos to Brian and the management. The restaurant was busy but werewolf I. and treated wonderfully. Great job!

data.title: Very satisfied...
data.text: We were very satisfied from start to finish with this Restarurant......very friendly, every aspect of the Inn was impecibly clean...visually perfect....something for kids and adults at all times on the menu...my pasta and chicken dish was amazing with just the right amount of garlic...had 1 great mix drink off the cocktail menu ...,my party didn't want to leave either....food was best I have ever had at any hotel.....

data.title: Nice Hotel Restaurant
data.text: Had lunch there - very good and good service!!!  Was not busy at the time we were there, so, service was extremely efficient and pleasant. Also, enjoyed the breakfast buffet. Good, for a buffet. Everything fresh and hot!!!

data.title: basic food at a fair price
data.text: Good hotel restaurant. Quiet and simple decor. Food is fresh and nicely presented. Excellent house salad. Drinks were good and not overpriced. Have gone three times and will return.

data.title: First nights dinner
data.text: The first night they were out of rib eye steaks, but the prime rib was good. Second night we had cocktails in the bar and was given complimentary hor dourves which was a nice surprise

data.title: Good hotel restaurant, especially if you don't want to get out on the road.
data.text: Sauteed calamari was fantastic, and could have eaten a large order just for a main dish.  Prime rib wasn't especially hot, but was prepared medium rare as requested.  Chocolate cake and a glass of house red wine was enjoyed in my room and both were tasty.

data.title: Overcooked prime rib, slow service
data.text:
My husband and I went to dinner this evening at Adam's Rib.  In a word, bleah.

We both ordered the prime rib, which comes with a cup of soup or a salad.  We each asked for the soup du jour, which was New England clam chowder, and asked for our prime rib medium rare.  I ordered a martini with a twist.

- The martini arrived with olives.  The server was good enough to obtain a twist for me, though.
- The clam chowder had a skin on top when it arrived.  We were also not provided with soup spoons.  I had to use my dessert spoon.
- The prime rib was well done.
- The "baked potato" turned out to be baked (or possibly fried) wedges of potato, not the big ol' spud one expects to slice open and douse with sour cream and chives.
- And the service?  Slo-o-o-o-ow.

Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.

owner_response.author: NorwalkInn, Owner at Adam's Rib, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Kaylee, Thank you for taking the time to submit your review. We understand your experience was part of a large group with individual checks from an unlimited, ala cart, menu.  Perhaps you are right, in this type of a function, the menu options should have been limited. For that, we apologize and hope you enjoyed the chef's complimentary, chocolate dessert. We would appreciate the opportunity to serve you again. Please let us know your thoughts, as we might try to clear up this understanding and ensure that your next visit to Adam's Rib, is a pleasant one.
Sincerely, Elizabeth Diaconescu Restaurant Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Limited but well cooked food
data.text: The food here is fairly basic - steaks, chicken and some sea food. The night we ate some dishes were not available. Our steaks were accurately cooked and tender and the vegetables were just right - crisp and not mushy. The caesar salad was fresh but the desserts were rather ordinary. Limited wine list but fairly priced. Good value for money. Friendly competent service.

data.title: Great food and staff
data.text:
I highly recommend the Chicken Samuel.  The flavor was delicious, it was perfectly cooked, and the chicken was very tender with not one bit of fat or gristle.  The prime rib is also very good.  My mother was a little disappointed that there was no Yorkshire pudding or horseradish sauce served with it; but this is a fading food "fashion", I think.

Our waiter was very friendly and attentive.  It is a small restaurant in the Norwalk Inn and Conference Center and worth the trip.

data.title: Great Experience
data.text: Loved the Food! Friendly Wait Staff and Immaculate Environment. Graceful and Orderly. Splendid Bar and Outdoor Patio w/Pool. Will definitely revisit. A++

data.title: A Landmark (Buried) Treasure in the Heart of Norwalk
data.text: With so many great restaurants in Fairfield County, it might be easy to overlook this long-standing landmark in Norwalk.  But rest assured, you will be delighted that you were one of the first to rediscover this lovely spot nestled in The Norwalk Inn & Conference Center.  The hotel was buzzing on the night we went, with private parties in the ballrooms and a reception in the glass-enclosed patio. The lobby was awash in warm wood tones, and the dining room was beautifully decorated and though quiet busy, wonderfully quiet.  The best was yet to come -- the food. Our waiter, Brian, made sure our drinks came quickly as we poured over the menu which, uncharacteristic to newer, trendy spots, had a perfect selection of steaks, seafood, chicken and pastas. It was hard to decide, but everyone in our party managed to find exactly what they wanted - and everyone had something different.  We all started with a salad: the caesar was one of the best we've had, and a signature salad with walnuts, gorgonzola, red onion, carrots and fresh greens was quickly gone from the plate.  Our entrees were superb: the perfect cut of prime rib, a generous expertly cooked rib eye and NY Strip, Scallops over risotto, and homemade ravioli - an ample portion not found in "shee-shee" Italian joints. The entrees came with a full complement of roasted potatoes, carrots, and best of all, the rib-eye was topped with onion rings -- although the person who got them refused to share.  Service was amazing: unobtrusive and efficient.  Although everyone left not a bite on their plates; we opted to split a few chocolate cakes for dessert.  Now, THIS was a serious slab of sweet - a combo of milk and dark chocolate cake, frosting, all atop a cookie crunch.  Not a morsel remained.  It's not often that a restaurant in a hotel, especially a small hometown Inn, can deliver on a five star meal. And all for less than $30/head. Adam's Rib is just that place.  But don't tell too many people; this is a secret treasure to keep to yourself.
